http__purl_org_dc_terms_description: The characteristic form in which a given species of plant grows

http__www_w3_org_2004_02_skos_core_defin: Plant living for two years and fruiting only in the second.
Any seed plant with non-woody green stems.
Plant which persists for several years.
Low-growing woody plant, usually less than 6 m high, that does not have a main trunk and which branches from the base.

(1) appl. structures or growth features that are marked off or completed yearly; (2) living for a year only; (3) completing life-cycle in a year from germination; (4) n. plant that completes its life-cycle in a year.
A woody perennial plant which has a single main trunk at least 7.5 cm in diameter at 1.3 m height, a definitely formed crown of foliage, and a height of at least 4 m.
